verses.verse: "My soul <WH5315> is weary <WH5354> of my life. <WH2416> I will give free course <WH5800> to my complaint. <WH7879> I will speak <WH1696> in the bitterness <WH4751> of my soul. <WH5315>
I will tell <WH559> God, <WH433> <WH7561> 'Do not condemn me. <WH3045> Show me why you contend with me. <WH7378>

Is it good <WH2895> to you that you should oppress, <WH6231> that you should despise <WH3988> the work <WH3018> of your hands, <WH3709> and smile <WH3313> on the counsel <WH6098> of the wicked? <WH7563>
Do you have eyes <WH5869> of flesh? <WH1320> Or do you see <WH7200> as man <WH582> sees? <WH7200>
Are your days <WH3117> as the days <WH3117> of mortals, <WH582> or your years <WH8141> as man <WH582>'s years, <WH8141>
that you inquire <WH1245> after my iniquity, <WH5771> and search <WH1875> after my sin? <WH2403>
Although you know <WH1847> that I am not wicked, <WH7561> there is no one who can deliver <WH5337> out of your hand. <WH3027>
<WH3027>"'Your hands have framed <WH6087> me and fashioned <WH6213> me altogether, <WH3162> <WH5439> yet you destroy me. <WH1104>
Remember, <WH2142> I beg you, <WH6213> that you have fashioned me as clay. <WH2563> Will you bring <WH7725> me into dust <WH6083> again? <WH7725>
Haven't <WH5413> you poured me out like milk, <WH2461> and curdled <WH7087> me like cheese? <WH1385>
You have clothed <WH3847> me with skin <WH5785> and flesh, <WH1320> and knit <WH7753> me together with bones <WH6106> and sinews. <WH1517>
You have granted <WH6213> me life <WH2416> and loving kindness. <WH2617> Your visitation <WH6486> has preserved <WH8104> my spirit. <WH7307>
Yet you hid <WH6845> these things in your heart. <WH3824> I know that this is with you: <WH3045>
if I sin, <WH2398> then you mark <WH8104> me. <WH5352> You will not acquit me from my iniquity. <WH5771>

If I am wicked, <WH7561> woe <WH480> to me. <WH6663> If I am righteous, I still shall not lift up <WH5375> my head, <WH7218> being filled <WH7649> with disgrace, <WH7036> and conscious <WH7202> of my affliction. <WH6040>
If my head is held high, <WH1342> you hunt <WH6679> me like a lion. <WH7826> Again <WH7725> you show yourself powerful to me. <WH6381>
You renew <WH2318> your witnesses <WH5707> against me, <WH7235> and increase your indignation <WH3708> on me. <WH5978> Changes <WH2487> and warfare are with me. <WH6635>
<WH3318>"'Why, then, have you brought me forth out of the womb? <WH7358> I wish I had given up the spirit, <WH1478> and no eye <WH5869> had seen me. <WH7200>
I should have been as though I had not been. <WH2986> I should have been carried from the womb <WH990> to the grave. <WH6913>
Aren't <WH3117> my days few? <WH4592> Cease <WH2308> then. <WH7896> Leave me alone, that I may find a little <WH4592> comfort, <WH1082>
before I go <WH3212> where I shall not return <WH7725> from, <WH776> to the land of darkness <WH2822> and of the shadow of death; <WH6757>
the land <WH776> dark <WH5890> as midnight, <WH652> of the shadow of death, <WH6757> without any order, <WH5468> where the light <WH3313> is as midnight. <WH652>'"
